Sr. TME for Desktop Processor Marketing and Lab Manager Intel Corporation June 2006  –  April 2011  (4 years 11 months) I currently develop and execute the desktop processor marketing demo strategy. I also develop and manage demos for our division's key events such as ISMC, the ATZ at IDF, and IRUM. I develop the desktop processor demo guide for use in the field and channel as well as supply parts and demos for other organizations such as Corp Demos and SSG. I also manage the desktop processor lab in Hillsboro. Sr Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1993  –  April 2011  (17 years 8 months) I design, build and give computer and technology demonstrations. I Write technical documentation, develop classes and demonstrations for training. I also debug and test new technologies as well as write code for Java and Flash. Sr. DPS Xeon Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation April 2003  –  June 2006  (3 years 3 months) Worked with multiple development teams in SSG and EPG to define and develop the future versions of Software Development Platforms (SDP) for distribution to internal and external customers. I define and drive the technologies enabling roadmaps for the Xeon development platforms as well as drive SSG technical needs in board and system meetings. I create the technical and marketing documentation for all of the Xeon SDP as well. Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1999  –  April 2003  (3 years 8 months) Manage, develop and deliver Intel corporate demonstrations for use in executive keynote presentations and tradeshows around the world. I work across Intel divisions to identify technologies and create timelines, messaging, and support requirements for event demonstrations. I then create, reproduce, and document demos before shipping to various locations and performing the demos on stage. Technical Marketing Engineer and Unix lead Intel Corporation November 1996  –  September 1999  (2 years 11 months) Managed all aspects of Server product completeness within EMSD as well as coordinated and provided Unix support across all EMSD platforms. I was involved with project leadership, investigation and disposition of errata, writing technical documents and training in support of ESG's products during design, development, and production phases. Interfaced with many Intel/ESG internal groups such as design engineering, system validation, compatibility labs, product marketing and business development, as well as external groups such as FSEs/FAEs and Major OEM/Distribution customers. Designed and taught 6 top ranked courses at Intel field sales conferences. Account Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1995  –  November 1996  (1 year 3 months) Technical customer interface for major accounts (Fujitsu/NEC/NCR/Micron/DG). Managed the closure of technical issues, communication of product updates and changes with server production products. Tracked, prioritized, and solved application/product issues reported by OEM customers, driving resolution across divisions both at Intel and customer sites. Author of technical white papers, engineering guidelines and other technical documents necessary for supporting our products. Communicated future customer requirements to product development and assisted in feature definition of new server products. Chaired customer and OEM meetings for business unit issue closure. Designed and implemented the OZZY subset of Intel servers. Configured our Internet connections including CSD/DSU's, Cisco router, and Ascend pipeline routers. Customer Manager Intel Corporation May 1995  –  September 1995  (5 months) Managed 150 temporary employees for the Intel Pentium Processor FDIV replacement program. Summary Over my 14 year career at Intel I have worked in software development, software validation, program management, and a technical marketing engineer for both hardware (LAN 1gig) and software (Linux, OpenStack, and Android). I have a broad understanding of the entire gamut of computers and related technologies including understanding how high speed differential signals propagate, how firmware interacts with hardware, how BIOS and the chipsets interact, and the many different programming languages.  
 
I enjoy the work I do now and am focusing on improving my Android technical depth across the entire OS software stack. I take a particular interest in how companies strategically respond to competition which is why I pursued an MBA earlier in my career. My goal is to continue working as a TME while I build a strong technical depth on Android with plans to eventually move into a strategic planning or marketing role. I enjoy the work I do now travelling to meet customers, developing product demos, and solving complex technical issues. Summary I am a 15-year veteran at Intel Corporation well versed in both technical and marketing skills. I have a passion for and enjoy working with cutting edge technology and envisioning new innovative usage models for the future. I have become very familiar with the global technology market, and have honed my business acumen through my experience in the PC industry working with executives and design teams from leading PC manufacturers and component suppliers world-wide.  
 
I have managed teams and stakeholders in multiple geographies, and demonstrated proven program management skills in launching a world-wide PC Energy Regulation Program for Intel. In my current product marketing role, I have the exciting job of defining technical features and sku offerings for future products and deciding which processors to market in the current retail market. I also have an extensive technical background performing motherboard design, platform debugging, defining test processes, and creating technical design specifications for PC components.
